title: Systems Engineer
description:
Flightradar24 is the world’s most popular flight tracking service. Millions of people use our website and mobile apps every day.
  
In addition to our systems and cloud infrastructures we operate a globally distributed network of 40,000 Raspberry Pi-based radio receivers, feeding real-time aircraft data into our platform.
  
We’re now looking for a talented and driven Systems Engineer who is well versed in system administration, modern private cloud, and automation. We are investing into an open-”hybrid multi-cloud” platform and we want to own, operate and develop our own infrastructure. With big focus on OpenStack and Kubernetes.
  
In our new on-prem platforms we are also using fully flexed L3 fabrics with BGP as the underlying routing protocol. This allows us to anycast our systems for greater scale when traffic ramps up 10 times without notice.
  
Does this sound exciting and want to know more? Apply and join us for a coffee. We are located in central Stockholm.
  
What you’ll do
  
Maintain and evolve our system infrastructure based on a private cloud environment as well as AWS and Azure cloud services
  
Standardize and automate the provisioning of infrastructure resources via Infrastructure-as-Code, orchestration, and configuration management
  
Optimize the reliability and performance of on-prem and cloud infrastructure
  
Contribute to and support scaling out of infrastructure and services to cloud platforms
  
Interact closely with our developers to deliver a highly performant and reliable live production platform, and investigate production issues for continuous improvement
  
Be part of developing our future private cloud based on open technologies like OpenStack, Ceph, and KVM, and integration with public clouds
  
**Over time work with much of our tech stack, including:** Debian Linux, Ansible, Terraform, Docker, MySQL, Redis Cluster, RabbitMQ, Kafka, Haproxy, Nginx, Cloudflare, AWS, Azure, Datadog, Jenkins and Kubernetes
  
Develop and maintain new tooling to replace existing SaaS like Datadog
  
Minimize cloud exposure towards hyperscalers like AWS and Azure
  
  

Who you are
  
Extensive professional experience in Linux system administration and operations, preferably on large-scale low latency systems
  
Hands-on experience with service orchestration, containerization, automation, scripting, configuration management
  
Passionate about high performance computing and want to modernize and optimize our infrastructure for the big flows of data that we process
  
Networking experience, e.g. switch and firewall configuration and routing, is desirable
  
AWS cloud experience, e.g. EC2, S3, RDS, IAM, VPC, ECS/EKS is a plus
  
A self-starter who naturally assumes responsibility for driving projects forward
  
Fluency in English, both spoken and written. Comfortable working in a distributed team of multiple nationalities
  
You enjoy shaving yaks and have a thing for herding kittens
  
You understand the KISS (keep it simple stupid) principle
  
You are into the BSD stack, we are using both FreeBSD and OpenBSD at Flightradar24!
  
  

About Flightradar24
  
With over 3 million daily users, Flightradar24 is the world’s most popular flight tracking service. Our app regularly tops the App Store and Google Play charts and our data is regularly cited by major media worldwide. We also offer a wide range of commercial services and customers include many of the largest names in aviation, including airlines, airports and manufacturers.
  
We're constantly adding new services and improving existing products. To help us meet those challenges, we're looking for creative, collaborative and tech-savvy applicants to join us.

title: Patent Engineer
description:
The Patent Engineer will primarily focus on the development and maintenance of a patent portfolio for innovations originating from SVPs’ development activities. The role includes management of a patent portfolio relating to mechanical, electrical and software engineering, with specific technology in sewing and embroidery machines.
  
The successful candidate will be expected to independently manage an active caseload, strategically direct outside counsel, and skillfully advise internal business colleagues. The Patent Engineer will work closely with a diverse and talented group of engineers to: identify, strategically file, and guide prosecution of patentable inventions, search and analyze competitive patents in key technology areas, provide technical analysis and freedom to operate opinions, aid in company-wide patent education initiatives, and help guide the development of new products.
  
  

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES :**  

Maintain a strong knowledge of SVP product lines, technologies, and industry technology applicable to project assignments
  
Integrate with assigned product and project teams
  
Monitor and assess competitive patents relevant to SVP products
  
Counsel engineers and other technical personnel regarding patentability, patent procedure, portfolio strategy and related issues and conduct training
  
Conduct patent clearance reviews and identify patents that need further study or formal opinions from outside counsel
  
Lead product patent mining sessions and prepare materials for outside counsel to be used in patent applications
  
Creation and implementation of strategy and procedures for patent management
  
Solicit, review, and manage approval process for invention disclosures
  
Confidently communicate to the project team patent updates throughout the development process
  
Independently and effectively manage and oversee outside counsel in the preparation and prosecution of patent applications in the U.S. and abroad while working within a budget
  
Knowledge and interest in patent-related issues associated with commercial agreements and licensing arrangements
  
  

SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE
  
Education / Experience
  
Bachelor’s degree required, strongly preferred in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, computer engineering, computer science (unrelated degree acceptable with equivalent professional experience)
  
Patent attorney/agent license or certification preferred
  
5+ years of experience
  
Experience managing a portfolio of patents and additional time sensitive projects in a fast-paced organization
  
Proficient understanding of patent filing and prosecution inside and outside of the United States
  
Assertive self-starter with excellent oral and written communication skills
  
Strong interpersonal skills and superior time-management skills
  
Demonstrated ability to provide practical and strategic legal advice to senior business leaders
  
  

**Preferred:**  

Experience in an industry which manufactures and/or sells a commercial product
  
Industry experience as an engineer, programmer or related role
  
  

**ABOUT THE COMPANY:**  

SVP Worldwide is the world’s largest consumer sewing machine company, accounting for approximately one out of every three household sewing machines sold annually across the globe. The company and its three iconic brands - SINGER®, VIKING®, and PFAFF® - have delighted consumers for over 460 years. These premium brands and products are regarded as the choice for serious sewists and novice crafters.
  
The company’s corporate headquarters is in Nashville, TN, and supported by regional headquarters/sales offices located in Milan (Italy), and Mexico City (Mexico) that, combined, reach consumers in more than 180 countries. SVP has manufacturing facilities across Asia and Latin America, multiple R&D centers, and a global supply chain with distribution centers in all regions.
  
SVP Worldwide has a history of innovation and has established a leading offering in the Internet-of-Things (IoT) segment by introducing mySewnet®, the industry’s first cloud-based operating system. Its product portfolio covers entry-level sewing machines all the way up to advanced, internet-connected, leading-edge household sewing machines that retail for $18,999 and all segments in-between. In addition to sewing machines, the product portfolio includes sewing accessories, notions, garment care products as well as software.
  
The products are sold across a network of sewing machine dealers, mass retailers (e.g., Costco, Walmart, Lidl etc), specialty retailers (e.g., Joann, Michaels), online retailers (e.g., Amazon, Tmall), distributors, and through the company’s 170+ internally operated retail stores.
  
We are around 50 talented engineers at the R&D center in Jönköping, where some of the most advanced sewing and embroidery machines in the world are being developed.
  
  

THE INDUSTRY
  
The sewing machine industry is a global industry that is experiencing renewed growth. In developed markets, growth rates are projected to outpace GDP growth, according to Global Industry Analysts, Inc., the leading industry data source. Growth in these markets is driven by the millennial generation that is increasingly attracted to personalization, crafts, and self-expression. In developing markets, the industry is expected to grow at 4% annually, fueled by the emerging middle class and the “need to sew” segment that uses sewing machines to support the household.
  
  

THE FUTURE
  
In 2021, SVP Worldwide was acquired by Platinum Equity (www.platinumequity.com), a global investment firm with more than $25 billion of assets under management and a portfolio of approximately 50 operating companies that serve customers around the world. Platinum Equity has committed to fully support SVP’s continued growth and to bring additional financial and operational resources to bear to help accelerate the company’s efforts.
  
SVP is planning to invest even more in R&D to meet the increasing demand of new products and innovations.

title: Senior SQL DBA - Malmo
description:
We are currently looking for a **Senior SQL Database Administrator** to join our team and help us test and deliver quality software solutions that are fit for use and purpose. **This role is hybrid but could be based in the UK (Manchester or Whitley), Spain (Madrid), Denmark (Skanderborg), Sweden (Malmo) or Germany (Telgte)**.


But there’s more to this than just the ‘day job’. Tunstall is embarking upon a significant technical and business transformation programme that is focusing on changing the way in which we host and deliver our market leading solutions.

**A bit about us:**


Tunstall is a **market-leading health** and **care technology provider**.


We’re passionate about ensuring our team reflects the brilliant and unique qualities of the people and communities we support. Our incredible team of more than 3,000 colleagues provides **life saving and life changing technology and services to millions of people in 18 different countries**.


At Tunstall you’ll find a place where you’re valued and celebrated for being yourself. We empower our people to deliver the very best teamwork, innovation and thought leadership by creating an environment where we champion diversity and inclusion. We demonstrate our commitment to diversity and inclusion at each step. From our open, fair, and transparent recruitment processes, through to the many development and career growth opportunities we provide.

**Each Tunstall colleague has a superpower… they’re unique. No one else is them, and we think that’s special. Come and join our mission and be part of our team, our One Tunstall team.**

**What will you be doing in this role?**


As a Senior SQL DBA, you will be responsible for the management, maintenance, and optimization of our SQL Server instances, servers and databases, all of which are crucial to our operations in delivering reliable life critical services. This role requires a deep understanding of database architecture, performance tuning, and disaster recovery strategies. You will work closely with our global and region IT teams to ensure data integrity, security, and availability across all platforms.

**Main responsibilities for this role:**

* **Database Management:** Install, configure, and manage SQL Server databases in hosted, cloud and occasional on-premise environments. Ensure high availability and performance.
* **Mentoring and training**: Educating and training other technology professional within the organisation on good practice within your domain.
* **Performance Tuning:** Monitor database performance, identify bottlenecks, and implement solutions to optimize performance. Utilize indexing, query optimization, and other techniques.
* **Backup and Recovery:** Design, implement, and manage backup and recovery strategies. Ensure data is recoverable and secure.
* **Security:** Implement and maintain robust security measures to protect sensitive healthcare data in compliance with global data protection regulations (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR).
* **Data Integration:** Support ETL processes, data migrations, and integration projects with other systems and third-party applications.
* **Database Development:** Collaborate with application developers to design database schemas, stored procedures, and functions. Provide support for database-related application development.
* **Code Optimization Collaboration:** Work closely with development teams to review and optimize SQL code, ensuring efficient data retrieval and minimizing performance issues. Provide guidance and best practices on writing optimized SQL queries and database interactions.
* **Monitoring and Maintenance:** Set up and manage monitoring systems to proactively identify and address issues. Perform regular maintenance tasks, including updates and patch management.
* **Documentation:** Maintain comprehensive documentation of database configurations, processes, and procedures. Ensure documentation is up-to-date and accessible.
* **Collaboration and Support:** Work closely with IT, data analytics, and business intelligence teams to support data-related initiatives and troubleshoot issues.
* **Continuous Improvement**: Stay current with emerging database technologies and best practices. Propose and implement improvements to database systems and processes.

**Key skills and experience:**

**Technical Proficiency**

* Expertise in SQL Server (all versions), including setup, configuration, patching, and upgrades.
* Strong knowledge of database performance tuning and optimization (PTO), using tools like SQL Profiler, Execution Plans, and DMVs.
* Experience with high-availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) solutions such as Always On Availability Groups, Clustering, Replication, Log Shipping, and Backup/Restore strategies.
* Familiarity with cloud-based SQL environments, such as Azure SQL, AWS RDS for SQL Server, or Google Cloud SQL.
* Proficiency in T-SQL scripting, including stored procedures, triggers, and complex queries.
* Understanding of ETL processes and working with tools like SSIS.

**Operational and Analytical Skills:**

* Proficient in monitoring database performance and troubleshooting issues with tools like SolarWinds DPA, Redgate, or native SQL tools.
* Experience with database security, including encryption, access control, and auditing.
* Strong knowledge of data governance and managing metadata (ideally for healthcare data).

**Required experience:**

* Proven experience as a SQL DBA, with a strong track record of managing mission-critical databases.
* Experience in a healthcare or telehealth organization is highly desirable.
* Demonstrated expertise in scaling databases to support large scale operations, including real-time data access.
* Proven experience in working within regulatory frameworks like HIPAA, GDPR, or HITECH.
* Familiarity with audit preparation and reporting for database compliance.
* Proven experience in managing and resolving critical database outages with minimal downtime.
* Knowledge of emergency response protocols for ensuring 24/7 database availability.

**Desirable skills and experience**

* Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator Associate or Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate (desirable)
* Hands-on experience with API-based integrations and middleware (desirable)

**If you are not sure if you have the relevant skills or experience, then please apply (only takes a few minutes) and let our team review and come back to you.**

**What we offer:**


Our benefits vary from region to region but, we are confident that what we offer is competitive in each location. We would be happy to talk through this on a case-by-case basis

title: Senior Unified Communications Engineer - Malmo
description:
We are currently looking for a **Senior Unified Communications Engineer** to join our team and help us test and deliver quality software solutions that are fit for use and purpose. **This role is hybrid but could be based in the UK (Manchester or Whitley), Spain (Madrid), Denmark (Skanderborg), Sweden (Malmo) or Germany (Telgte)**.


But there’s more to this than just the ‘day job’. Tunstall is embarking upon a significant technical and business transformation programme that is focusing on changing the way in which we host and deliver our market leading solutions.

**A bit about us:**


Tunstall is a **market-leading health** and **care technology provider**.


We’re passionate about ensuring our team reflects the brilliant and unique qualities of the people and communities we support. Our incredible team of more than 3,000 colleagues provides **life saving and life changing technology and services to millions of people in 18 different countries**.


At Tunstall you’ll find a place where you’re valued and celebrated for being yourself. We empower our people to deliver the very best teamwork, innovation and thought leadership by creating an environment where we champion diversity and inclusion. We demonstrate our commitment to diversity and inclusion at each step. From our open, fair, and transparent recruitment processes, through to the many development and career growth opportunities we provide.

**Each Tunstall colleague has a superpower… they’re unique. No one else is them, and we think that’s special. Come and join our mission and be part of our team, our One Tunstall team.**

**What will you be doing in this role?**


As a Unified Communications Engineer you will be responsible for the design, implementation, and management of both analogue and digital communication systems, ensuring seamless collaboration and connectivity across the organization. This role requires expertise in telephony, VoIP, video conferencing, messaging platforms, and legacy analogue systems, with a strong focus on maintaining performance, security, and reliability.

**Main responsibilities in this role include:**

* Design, configure, and deploy UC solutions, including IP telephony, video conferencing, messaging systems, and analog communication technologies.
* Upgrade legacy analog systems to integrate with digital and IP-based platforms while ensuring minimal disruption.
* Evaluate and implement scalable UC architectures that support business growth.
* Administer and maintain UC platforms such as Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM), Microsoft Teams, Zoom, or similar tools.
* Monitor system performance and perform routine maintenance to ensure optimal uptime and reliability.
* Ensure seamless integration of analog and digital communication systems with enterprise IT infrastructure.
* Collaborate with networking teams to optimize QoS (Quality of Service) and bandwidth utilization for UC traffic.
* Work with third-party vendors to ensure compatibility and smooth operation of hybrid communication systems.
* Act as a subject matter expert (SME) for all UC-related issues, providing level 3 support to resolve complex problems.
* Maintain logs and documentation for incidents, resolutions, and system changes.
* Implement security best practices to protect voice, video, and messaging systems from unauthorized access and breaches.
* Provide training and mentorship to junior engineers or administrators on UC tools and practices.
* Migrate or phase out legacy systems by implementing modern, cost-effective solutions.

**Key skills and experience:**

**Essential**

* Proven experience in Unified Communications or a related field.
* Detailed hands-on experience with analog systems (e.g., PBX, SIP gateways)
* Detailed hands-on experience with modern UC platforms (e.g., Microsoft Teams, Cisco WebEx).
* Strong knowledge of VoIP protocols (SIP, RTP, H.323) and telephony systems.
* Proficiency in managing PBX systems, SIP trunks, and analog-to-digital migrations.
* Familiarity with network troubleshooting tools for UC traffic, such as Wireshark or SolarWinds.

Cisco Certified Network Associate Collaboration (CCNA Collaboration) or equivalent.  
* 

**Desirable**

* Experience in cloud-based UC solutions like Zoom Phone, RingCentral, or Cisco Webex Calling.
* Scripting or automation experience for UC tasks (e.g., PowerShell, Python).
* Understanding of ITIL frameworks and best practices in incident management
* Knowledge of legacy infrastructure, including paging systems and analog signal processing.

**If you are not sure if you have the relevant skills or experience, then please apply (only takes a few minutes) and let our team review and come back to you.**

**What we offer:**


Our benefits vary from region to region but, we are confident that what we offer is competitive in each location. We would be happy to talk through this on a case-by-case basis

title: Enterprise Account Executive, EMEA
description:
**Location**  

We are looking to hire an Enterprise Account Executive anywhere in the UK, Ireland, Estonia, Germany, Netherlands, Switzerland, and Sweden.We are currently only accepting applications from candidates located in these countries.

**About DoiT:**
DoiT is a global technology company that works with cloud-driven organizations to leverage the cloud to drive business growth and innovation. We combine data, technology, and human expertise to ensure you're operating in a well-architected and scalable state - from planning to production.

Delivering DoiT Cloud Intelligence, the only solution that integrates advanced technology with human intelligence, we help you solve complex multicloud problems and drive efficiency.

With decades of multicloud experience, we have specializations in Kubernetes, GenAI, CloudOps, and more. An award-winning strategic partner of AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure, we work alongside more than 4,000 customers worldwide.

**The Opportunity**  

As an Enterprise Account Executive, you will apply best-in-class pipeline generation, deal management, solution pitching, negotiation, and closing skills to drive the growth of DoiT's product across enterprise and mid-market prospects with over $1m+ in monthly cloud spend. You will champion the proprietary technology that DoiT provides to customers, and bring opportunities through the full sales cycle. Using your passion, you help spread the magic of DoiT to organizations everywhere.

**Responsibilities**
* Deliver against assigned sales and pipeline goals while prioritizing an outstanding customer experience for our prospects
* Build out territory plan for DoiT technology sales, specifically around DoiT's proprietary products.
* Partnering with the Solution Engineering team to drive solutions focused sales conversations with prospects that highlight the value of DoiT's product and service offering.
* Drive business development, forecast accurately and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle
* Refine the customer sales cycle, focusing on reducing friction to buy, and speeding adoption of DoiT Cloud Intelligence™
* Contribute to territory strategy in generating and developing business growth opportunities
* Explore and understand complex customer requirements on both a business and technical level
* Collaborate with DoiT marketing team members on pipeline generation campaigns, driving attendance to events, and ensuring DoiT hears the true voice of the customer.
**Qualifications**
* BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 5+ years of quota-carrying sales experience in Enterprise SaaS and a consistent record of meeting and exceeding sales quotas
* Technically minded, with experience and understanding of the public cloud ecosystem and cloud management technologies
* High degree of self-discipline, accurate sales forecasting and salesforce hygiene
* "Roll up your sleeves" perspective that pervades both sales as well as business development and top of funnel activities
* An entrepreneur at heart who is independent, creative, passionate and approachable
* Self-organized, Goal-oriented, self-motivated individual who is confident, thorough, and tenacious
* Analytical, Data-driven, detail-oriented and able to "zoom" in/out from the big picture to the minutiae.
* Ability to effectively operate with flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal


**Are you a Do'er?**  

Be your truest self. Work on your terms. Make a difference.



We are home to a global team of incredible talent who work remotely and have the flexibility to have a schedule that balances your work and home life. We embrace and support leveling up your skills professionally and personally.

What does being a Do'er mean? We're all about being entrepreneurial, pursuing knowledge and having fun! Click here to learn more about our core values.

Sounds too good to be true? Check out our Glassdoor Page.
We thought so too, but we're here and happy we hit that 'apply' button.
* Unlimited Vacation
* Flexible Working Options
* Health Insurance
* Parental Leave
* Employee Stock Option Plan
* Home Office Allowance
* Professional Development Stipend
* Peer Recognition Program
**Many Do'ers, One Team**
DoiT unites as *Many Do'ers, One Team*, where diversity is more than a goal—it's our strength. We actively cultivate an inclusive, equitable workplace, recognizing that each unique perspective enhances our innovation. By celebrating differences, we create an environment where every individual feels valued, contributing to our collective success.

title: Test Manager
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

 As a Test Manager in PEU-RP you will as a technical leader drive and define test analysis of new 5G RAN features, for both Purpose built and Cloud RAN deployments, to secure the most efficient and effective test coverage, which ensures product quality and an optimized product flow. Additionally, you will continuously optimize legacy test coverage using several methods for an appropriate risk level. In this context, you will work closely with a wide network including other technical leaders, program organization, product owners, Systems/Design/Test/Customer Support teams etc., and play an active role in inspiring and educating the test community on test strategies and test practices, to secure all the assigned test activities across product test flow are within approved cost, time, and quality frame.

  

We emphasize team work, communication and co-operation. We expect you to be a strong team player and thereby contributing to the teams’ successes. We expect you to be willing to step forward and take responsibility and actively drive issues as well as taking part in all aspects of the Test Manager role. We also expect you to live by Ericsson core values professionalism, respect, perseverance and integrity. We provide an open working climate and diversity where all opinions and contributions are appreciated as well as a possibility to work with the latest technology telecommunication development.

 **What you will do:**  

* Drive Test Analysis work of 5G RAN features and products during study and development phases to set and communicate test scope on all levels
* Support development teams to follow and adhere to test strategies to ensure timely and cost efficient test
* Identify test tools impact and/or risks for new features and products and follow up the implementation
* Identify and forecast test environment requirements
* Secure that detailed test scope is performed during the execution phase to ensure test coverage and quality
* Contribute to test strategies and new test methodologies to enhance test efficiency
* Educate and support the organisation on test strategy and efficient testing
 **Skills you bring:**  

* University education M.Sc/B.Sc in Computer science/Telecommunication/Electrical engineering or equivalent experience
* Minimum 5 years of experience in 5G RAN development or deployment (e.g., from Systems, Design, Feature Verification, System Verification, CI/CD or Customer Support)
* Good understanding of software development and testing processes, including Agile and Waterfall methodologies
* Ability to communicate effectively in written and verbal English
* Strong problem solving skills to devise innovative solutions for testing challenges and analytical abilities to troubleshoot complex issues
* Ability to articulate and convey complex technical information effectively to stakeholders
* Ability to lead a group of people and inspire and mentor testing teams
* Ability to handle changing requirements and project scopes with a flexible mindset
* Advantages for this position: Experience from Test Strategy work, Knowledge in AI and Machine Learning in test, Data driven test management, Next generation software development
**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary Recruiter:** [[Anitha Pulluru]]

**Hiring Manager:** [[Muhammad Usman]]

title: Senior Solution Sales Executive - Nordics
description:
- **Devoteam is a leading Google Cloud Partner, empowering businesses to harness the full potential of Google Cloud technologies.**  

  

With 20+ years ofsuccessful Google Cloud implementations and a team of certified experts, we drive digital transformation across various industries. We foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning, providing you with the tools and support you need to excel in your career.


At Devoteam, we champion a revolutionary "New Way of Work" that prioritizes flexibility, personal growth, and joint success.

  
**Accelerate Your Career: Senior Solution Sales Executive - Google Cloud**

Are you a seasoned sales professional with a passion for cloud technology and a proven track record of success in the IT consulting space? Devoteam is seeking a highly motivated Senior Solution Sales Executive to join our expanding Google Cloud practice. In this role, you will drive new business acquisition and revenue growth by selling our comprehensive suite of Google Cloud consulting services and solutions, with a focus on professional services.


**What You'll Do:**

* **Develop and execute a strategic sales plan:** Target key accounts, identify opportunities, and build a strong pipeline to achieve ambitious quotas and revenue targets.
* **Become a Trusted Advisor:** Conduct in-depth needs assessments, understand client challenges, and position Devoteam as their go-to partner for Google Cloud solutions.
* **Deliver Winning Presentations:** Craft and deliver compelling sales presentations that showcase the value proposition of our Google Cloud offerings, emphasizing our expertise in professional services.
* **Collaborate with Experts:** Work closely with our technical consultants to design and propose tailored solutions that address client requirements, ensuring seamless project delivery.
* **Negotiate and Close Deals:** Secure favorable terms and conditions, maximizing revenue and profitability while building long-term client relationships.
* **Stay Ahead of the Curve:** Maintain a deep understanding of the evolving Google Cloud ecosystem, including new products, services, and market trends, to provide cutting-edge solutions.

  
* **Proven Success:** A demonstrable track record of exceeding sales targets in the IT consulting services industry, with experience selling technology solutions.
* **Cloud Expertise:** Strong understanding of cloud computing concepts, with specific knowledge of the Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* **Enterprise Focus:** Experience selling to enterprise clients is highly desirable, with a proven ability to navigate complex sales cycles and build relationships with key decision-makers.
* **Communication & Presentation Excellence:** Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts clearly and concisely.
* **Negotiation & Closing Prowess:** Strong negotiation and closing skills, with a proven ability to secure favorable deals.
* **Team Player:** Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team in a fast-paced environment.
* **Education:** Bachelor's degree in business, technology, or a related field.

  
- Devoteam is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. We encourage applications from individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences.



	* **Competitive Compensation:** Enjoy a competitive compensation package with an uncapped commission structure, rewarding your hard work and success.
	* **Comprehensive Benefits:** Benefit from comprehensive health insurance, a retirement plan, and generous paid time off.
	* **Growth Opportunities:** Take advantage of excellent opportunities for professional development and career advancement within our growing Google Cloud practice.
	* **Cutting-Edge Technology:** Work with the latest Google Cloud technologies and contribute to impactful projects that transform businesses.
	* **Dynamic Culture:** Be part of a dynamic, supportive, and collaborative team culture that values innovation and personal growth.
	* **Flexible Work Arrangements:** Enjoy flexible work arrangements that allow you to balance your professional and personal life.**To Apply:**

Please submit your resume and cover letter. We are excited to hear from you!

title: IT Technician/Cloud Specialist
description:
**IT Technician – Cloud Specialist** 




 Vill du vara en del av den spännande världen inom rederibranschen och samtidigt utvecklas i din karriär? Då är det här din chans!
 



**Placering:** 
 Mariehamn eller Helsingfors (vi utlyser tjänsten i Sverige för kandidater som är bosatta här men som förhoppningsvis är intresserade av att flytta till Mariehamn eller Helsingfors med omnejd.).
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Rederiaktiebolaget Eckerö är en ledande aktör inom rederibranschen med säte i Mariehamn. Med över 50 år i branschen har vi en stark närvaro på Ålands hav och Finska viken. Vi är stolta över att erbjuda våra kunder förstklassig service och innovativa lösningar. Nu söker vi en senior IT-tekniker till vårt infrastrukturteam för att tillsammans forma framtiden i vår växande organisation.
 



 Vi arbetar agilt, och Infrastrukturteamet spelar en central roll i att stötta både övriga team på IT-avdelningen och direkt i verksamheten. Tjänsten är varierande, med din huvudsakliga arbetsplats på kontoret, men besök ombord på fartygen ingår regelbundet.
 



  





**Ditt uppdrag** 




 Som senior IT-tekniker blir du en del av ett team på fyra personer. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:
 


* Nyinstallation, underhåll, felsökning och utveckling av IT-infrastrukturen.
* Hantering och optimering av tjänster i
 **Azure** 
 , där vi ständigt utvecklar vår hybridmiljö.
* Ansvar för rederiets servrar, kommunikationssystem och nätverk, både på land och ombord på fartygen, med fokus på stabilitet, redundans och säkerhet.



  





**Din profil** 




 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har följande erfarenhet och egenskaper:
 


* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av serverinstallationer och arbete med större nätverksmiljöer.
* Erfarenhet av hantering av
 **IaaS i Azure** 
 .
* Förmåga att kommunicera tydligt med både kollegor och verksamheten.
* En stark förmåga att arbeta självständigt men också fungera väl i team.
* Ett brinnande intresse för nätverk och kommunikation.
* Bekvämlighet i att arbeta i komplexa nätverks- och servermiljöer.



 Vårt arbetsspråk är svenska, och vi förväntar oss att du har goda kunskaper i engelska. Kunskaper i finska är meriterande.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 



* Utmanande och varierande arbetsuppgifter som låter dig utvecklas i din roll.
* Ett team präglat av samarbete och kunskapsdelning.
* Kontinuerlig utbildning och möjlighet till certifieringar för din professionella utveckling.
* Attraktiva förmåner och en inspirerande arbetsmiljö, både på land och ombord på våra fartyg.



  





**Ansökan** 




 Vi håller intervjuer löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag! På grund av GDPR kan vi inte ta emot ansökningar via e-post – ansök därför via länk.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till vårt tekniska team!
 



  





**Om Eckerö Line** 




 Eckerö Line är ett rederi vars fartyg m/s Finlandia trafikerar Finska viken mellan Helsingfors och Tallinn under finsk flagg. Vi fokuserar både på frakt- och passagerartrafik.
 



 Företaget grundades 1994 och erbjuder en bred portfölj av tjänster, inklusive paketresor, detaljhandel, restaurangverksamhet, konferenser, gruppresor, hotellpaket och frakttransport.

title: Project Leader - Port Infrastructure
description:
* **Job Title: Project Leader - Port Infrastructure**
* **Assignment Type: Annually Renewable Contract Position**
* **Location: Stockholm/ Boden or Piteå, Sweden (Candidate can choose preferred work location)**
* **Work Schedule: Monday – Friday (9 hours per day)**
* **Rotation: If necessary we can offer rotation for this role. 6 weeks at Site (5-6 days a week as required) and 2 weeks home working with leave to be agreed**



  





 Kintec are currently partnered with a pioneering
 **Green Steel Production Company** 
 who are constructing a plant in Northern Sweden that will produce Green Steel – Green Steel production emits up to 95% less CO₂ compared conventional steel production.
 



  





**JOB DESCRIPTION** 




  





**Project Leader - Port Infrastructure** 




  





 We are strengthening our infrastructure team with an External Infrastructure Project Leader for port infrastructure to help get all the port infrastructure in place that will be necessary for us to be able to start producing green steel in Boden in 2026.
 



 The infrastructure projects will be handled by the municipalities and municipality-owned companies in close dialogue with CLIENT. The infrastructure is critical for CLIENT operations but could also be utilized by other users with operations in the relevant areas.
 



 In the role of Project Leader for port infrastructure, you will play a key role in making sure that the Infrastructure needs of CLIENT are being met. This will mean creating alignment internally and understanding what our requirements/needs are from a technical perspective and then building relationships with key stakeholders at municipalities, the county administrative board, government bodies and agencies and main suppliers.
 



 You will report to our External Infrastructure Manager, and be a part of our Infrastructure team but also collaborate closely with functions like Public Affairs, Communications, Operations, Project Delivery, Legal and Finance.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 







* Manage the port infrastructure processes from a CLIENT perspective
* Ensure infrastructure is designed and built according to CLIENT needs through coordination between stakeholders from Operations and Project Delivery teams both internally and externally.
* Create work plans and monitor progress in dialogue with relevant internal and external stakeholders to ensure alignment with the CLIENT Boden Project time plan
* Monitor and manage project risks in dialogue with stakeholders
* Lead the processes of setting up and negotiating service contracts with the main service providers of the port infrastructure in accordance with potential regulation and market best practice, in collaboration with other CLIENT functions such as finance and legal
* Contribute to potential public procurement processes managed by external stakeholders



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Academic education/ engineering or business
* Excellent written and verbal communication in English and Swedish
* Grit and resilience
* Strong stakeholder management skills and ability to build trustful relationships
* Proven ability to manage projects related to planning, engineering, and/ or construction of infrastructure.



  





**Nice to have** 



* Experience from working with public sector organizations
* Swedish skills, in speaking and writing

title: CTO
description:
**CTO to Intelliplan** 




  





 We’re looking for a visionary CTO passionate about leadership and technical innovation. As CTO at Intelliplan, you’ll play a central role in revolutionizing the staffing and recruitment industry. You’ll drive our technical strategy, lead a high-performing team, and build solutions that make a difference for our customers every time they use our platform.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Shape and execute our technical strategy, ensuring stability, scalability, and user-friendliness.
* Lead and inspire our development team, fostering a culture of innovation and collaboration.
* Partner closely with the CEO to scale our SaaS business and drive strategic initiatives.
* Develop a platform that sets industry standards and delights our customers.

**Qualifications** 



* Strong technical expertise in .NET, C#, React, and Azure. Experience in database-intensive environments and scalable solutions.

* Results-driven – you don’t just plan, you deliver.
* Strategic thinker who is comfortable acting as the CEO’s right hand in critical business matters.

**About Intelliplan** 




 Intelliplan is the market leader in Sweden, with over 70% market share, and the second-largest player in Denmark. We’re on an exciting journey to double our revenue by 2027 through organic growth and strategic acquisitions. As CTO, you’ll be a key player in this transformative journey.
 



 Ready to make your mark?
 



 Apply today – we’re excited to shape the future of staffing and recruitment with you!

title: Manager of Customer Success
location: Upplands Väsby och Sollentuna, Stockholm County, Sweden

title: Junior Support Engineer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 200 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 You’ll join a well versed, “jack of all trades” team called the Solutions team, our scope is wide, reaching from e-com integrations, endpoint management, procurements to installing network equipment in our four warehouses. The solution department sorts under the Tech Department and works closely with multiple departments in the company.
   

  

 As a Junior Support Engineer in the Solutions team, you will be working with a wide range of departments, amazing co-workers, and a high variation of tasks. Your main objective is to give our co-workers within Haypp a helping technical hand, resolving issues high to low. This can vary from replacing a HDMI cable, troubleshoot why outlook is not working as expected, onboard a new co-worker by helping to setup their gear, to remotely restore computers across the Atlantic. You will have the opportunity to be a part of a wide range of IT projects outside of the day-to-day together with our senior engineers.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Respond to IT issues, including hardware maintenance, software, and networking.
* Help set up, install, and configure hardware and software systems according to specifications.
* Provide technical assistance and training to users to improve their computer skills.
* Work on IT projects together with Cloud Workspace Engineers.
* Identify and troubleshoot technical issues on-site or remotely.
* Monitor and maintain computer systems and networks to ensure they run smoothly.
* Document actions taken to resolve IT issues to develop a solutions database and for future reference.
* Escalate complex issues to Cloud Workspace Engineers.
* Perform regular updates and maintenance tasks on company devices and systems.
* Assist in the creation and maintenance of IT documentation, including procedural guides and manuals


**What We Want From You**
* A good understanding of computer systems, mobile devices, and other tech products.
* Knowledge of network management, system maintenance, and user support.
* Experience from support ticket systems like Jira.
* Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
* The ability to explain complex IT concepts in simple terms.
* Knowledge in endpoint management using tools like Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Defender, Microsoft Purview, and SIEM tools such as Microsoft Sentinel are a plus.
* Ability to work 100% on-site or hybrid remote with a minimum of 3 days/week in the Stockholm office


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *No Douchebags* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Viktoria Sobolewski or Philip Anderberg at viktoria.sobolewski@hayppgroup.com, philip.anderberg@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 950 000 consumers.

title: Technical Product Manager - Shared Components (Real Time Communication)
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Product Manager to own and drive the roadmap and requirements for critical shared components within our Real Time Communication product suite. You will be the key link between engineering, product and product operation stakeholders, ensuring alignment and successful delivery of impactful solutions.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Our Real-Time Communication team is building the future of real time communication for enterprises! We're passionate about creating seamless and engaging experiences across a suite of products that connect people worldwide. This includes programmable voice, in-app calling, verification, number lookup and fax solutions. All of these products generate billions of events every year that results in insightful and business critical data both for us at Sinch and for our customers. As we continue to grow and innovate, we need a talented Technical Product Manager to lead the charge of our platform team, Shared Components.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define and implement a strategy for collecting, analysing, and leveraging AI and usage data across all RTCx products.
* Define roadmap and requirements for our common financial and business intelligence pipelines.
* Define roadmap and requirements for our configuration tool used for operating all RTCx products.
* Work closely with product managers across different RTCx products and Sinch to ensure seamless integration and consistent data model and standard.
* Provide technical guidance and support to the engineering team, contributing to architectural decisions and technology choices.


**Requirements**
* Professional experience as a Technical Product Manager with a focus on backend systems, data platforms or API based products.
* Experience of defining and detailing requirements.
* Strong knowledge of data flows, billing, account management, and configuration tools in large-scale systems.
* Proven track record of managing complex, cross-functional projects with a focus on scaling and reliability.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and various stakeholders.
* Technical background or experience with backend development, data infrastructure and analytics is highly preferred.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to deep dive into the technical details and complexity.
* Familiarity with data privacy regulations (e.g. GDPR) and AI.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: VP of Engineering - Stockholm
description:
**Join the planet’s most important fight!**
**Normative is now looking for a Vice President (VP) of Engineering in Stockholm to lead the Engineering organisation in Sweden**
 At Normative, we're on a mission to accelerate the transition to a net-zero world. We provide science-based carbon accounting software and tailored advice from net-zero experts, empowering companies to reduce their carbon footprints.
   

  

* Please Note: Due to the upcoming holiday period, applications may take longer to be reviewed and interviews may not begin until the New Year. Your patience is appreciated during this time \*


**About The Role**
 Normative is seeking a VP of Engineering to lead and optimize our engineering organization during a dynamic scale-up phase. This role is focused on driving impactful, continuous improvements in people and processes, fostering a high-performing engineering culture, and ensuring alignment with the company's overall objectives.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Operate effectively in a scale-up environment, navigating constraints, tight deadlines, and rapid change to deliver results.
* Develop and implement strategies to enhance team retention, velocity, impact, and quality without overhauling existing operations.
* Establish clear objectives for a world-class engineering organization and demonstrate actionable steps to achieve them.
* Thrive in an environment with unknowns, challenges, and unpredictability, maintaining a solution-oriented mindset.
* Lead Engineering Managers (EMs) and their teams, ensuring smooth execution and alignment without becoming a bottleneck for innovation or communication.
* Prioritize company outcomes over individual or team optimizations, aligning efforts to organizational goals.
* Work in close partnership with the CTO, focusing on people and process leadership while supporting strategy, innovation, and high-impact projects without creating silos.


**What You Bring**
* Proven experience leading engineering teams in fast-paced scale-up environments, with a track record of successfully navigating complexity and constraints.
* Familiarity with both scale-up and large organization contexts, with a preference for scale-up experience as the primary focus.
* Demonstrated ability to implement incremental process improvements with measurable impact.
* Exceptional resilience, adaptability, and problem-solving skills in ambiguous and dynamic settings.
* Strong alignment with company-wide objectives and a collaborative, outcome-driven mindset.
* Experience in second-level management, including leading and mentoring Engineering Managers.


**The Team**
 Our core values and the culture we aim for:
   

  

* Stay mission-driven and data-informed
* Contribute to developing a team based on trust, transparency, and respect
* Strive for individual growth and team performance
* See feedback as a tool for improvement - we learn from our efforts; both successes and mistakes.
* Value continuous improvements over static best practices


 We also believe you enjoy working in an environment with typical challenges of a growing company, asking a lot of questions and learning new things. At Normative we believe that collaboration with teammates is essential and you’ll thrive if you like to explain and discuss technical approaches with other engineers.
   

  

 If you are a driven and passionate individual with a strong desire to make a positive impact on the world, and a real love for Engineering, we encourage you to apply. This is an exciting opportunity to join a mission-driven company and make a real difference in the fight against climate change.
   

  

 Join us and be a part of something bigger than yourself. Together, we can create a more sustainable future for all.
   

  

*Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications? Apply anyway!*
**Location**
 Normative operates on a hybrid remote model with offices in Stockholm, Copenhagen, and London. For this role you will be located in our wonderful HQ in Stockholm.
   

  

*At this time we are not able to offer relocation or VISA support for this position.*
**Benefits**
* Market-based salaries and annual merit-based salary reviews
* 30 days/year of paid vacation + up to 2 additional days off
* Pension and parental leave
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag) + 1 wellness hour per week
* Social and team-building activities (off-site, after work, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact on the world
* A friendly, supportive and humble working culture


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.*
**How To Apply**
 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
   

  

 Our interview process consists of 5 stages:
   

  

* Screening interview with a member of our Talent Acquisition team
* First interview with the hiring manager


*Online Personality & Logic assessment*
* Practical Case interview
* Team interview with members of the Engineering team
* Final Interview with our CEO


 We’re committed to hiring diversely. Having employees from diverse backgrounds brings a wealth of perspectives and experience to our team. We assess candidates based on their experience, skills and unique talents and evaluate everyone against the same criteria.
   

  

*Normative handles sensitive financial data and we will therefore conduct a background check before hiring any candidate.*

title: Second line support inom cloudtjänster
description:
Flera av våra kunder behöver förstärka sin IT-avdelning inom 2nd line support och Microsoft Azure. Har du erfarenhet inom Windows Server och Cloudtjänster med fokus på Microsoft tjänseutbud? Då är detta något för dig!
   

  

 Uppdraget är på heltid och kommer att pågå tills vidare.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Arbetsuppgifterna kommer bestå av installation, driftsättning, support och felsökning av olika IT-tjänster som Microsoft Azure, Windows servrar och nätverkslösningar. Du kommer att arbeta i företagets 2nd line-gruppering och hantera ärenden som är av mer kvalificerad karaktär och som har eskalerats via 1st line. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att innefatta supportering och felsökning av kundspecifika applikationer samt standardapplikationer som Microsoft 365 och Exchange. Här kommer du, tillsammans med dina kollegor, att arbeta nära kunderna med allt från små till stora uppdrag.
   

  

 Utöver detta kommer du även att arbeta med bland annat administration av Active Directory samt övervakning och felsökning av nätverk och skrivare.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 För att lyckas i den här rollen ser vi att du har lång erfarenhet från djupare felsökning, som att kunna läsa loggar och urskilja vad som framgår i dessa. Du har erfarenhet av Windows Server 2012 och uppåt så att du kan både sätta upp en server och drifta befintliga servrar.
   

  

 Som person är du ansvarstagande, serviceminded och lyhörd. Utöver ett tekniskt kunnande ska du också ha lätt för teamwork då bolagets målsättning är attt genuint omhänderta och serva sina kunder på absolut bästa sätt. Kundarbetet sköts primärt digitalt men kan i vissa fall även ske på plats, därför förväntas du kommunicera flytande på svenska och engelska såväl i tal som i skrift.
   

  

*Krav*
* Tydlig erfarenhet av Microsoft 365 inklusice Azure Domain Services
* Erfarenhet av planering om genomförande av systemmigrering vare sig det gäller operativsystem, affärssystem eller andra applikationer
* Erfarenhet av klientmanagering (RMM-system)
* God nätverksförståelse


*Det är meriterande om du även har erfarenhet, kunskap och utbildning inom:*
* Virtualisering – Hyper-V eller VMware
* MDM-lösningar
* Cisco Routing & Switching, Cisco Security och Cisco Wifi


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande och roliga aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under trevliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, och med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Business Development Intern
description:
**Company Description** 




 Digisource Consulting AB is a young and innovation-driven software solutions and consulting company based in Stockholm. We focus on providing digital transformation to enhance organizational agility, create new business models, optimize processes, and improve employee performance. Our service areas include Cloud,
 
 Gen AI,
 
 CRM, HCM, and e-commerce.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 This is an internship role at Digisource Consulting AB, located in Stockholm, with flexibility for remote work. The Business Development Intern will be responsible for tasks such as lead generation, market research, customer service, and communication. The role will involve supporting business development initiatives, acquiring new clients, and assisting in market expansion strategies. There is no fixed internship allowance for this role. We are looking for the selected intern to start in January.
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* Strong Communication skills in Swedish and English (both mandatory)
* Lead Generation experience - digital marketing and telemarketing
* Basic understanding of digital transformation technologies
* Strong organizational and time management skills
* Ability to work independently and in a team
* Experience in business development in an IT company a big plus

title: Systems Engineer
description:
Flightradar24 is the world’s most popular flight tracking service. Millions of people use our website and mobile apps every day.
   

  

 In addition to our systems and cloud infrastructures we operate a globally distributed network of 40,000 Raspberry Pi-based radio receivers, feeding real-time aircraft data into our platform.
   

  

 We’re now looking for a talented and driven Systems Engineer who is well versed in system administration, modern private cloud, and automation. We are investing into an open-”hybrid multi-cloud” platform and we want to own, operate and develop our own infrastructure. With big focus on OpenStack and Kubernetes.
   

  

 In our new on-prem platforms we are also using fully flexed L3 fabrics with BGP as the underlying routing protocol. This allows us to anycast our systems for greater scale when traffic ramps up 10 times without notice.
   

  

 Does this sound exciting and want to know more? Apply and join us for a coffee. We are located in central Stockholm.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Maintain and evolve our system infrastructure based on a private cloud environment as well as AWS and Azure cloud services
* Standardize and automate the provisioning of infrastructure resources via Infrastructure-as-Code, orchestration, and configuration management
* Optimize the reliability and performance of on-prem and cloud infrastructure
* Contribute to and support scaling out of infrastructure and services to cloud platforms
* Interact closely with our developers to deliver a highly performant and reliable live production platform, and investigate production issues for continuous improvement
* Be part of developing our future private cloud based on open technologies like OpenStack, Ceph, and KVM, and integration with public clouds
* Over time work with much of our tech stack, including: Debian Linux, Ansible, Terraform, Docker, MySQL, Redis Cluster, RabbitMQ, Kafka, Haproxy, Nginx, Cloudflare, AWS, Azure, Datadog, Jenkins and Kubernetes
* Develop and maintain new tooling to replace existing SaaS like Datadog
* Minimize cloud exposure towards hyperscalers like AWS and Azure


**Who You Are**
* Extensive professional experience in Linux system administration and operations, preferably on large-scale low latency systems
* Hands-on experience with service orchestration, containerization, automation, scripting, configuration management
* Passionate about high performance computing and want to modernize and optimize our infrastructure for the big flows of data that we process
* Networking experience, e.g. switch and firewall configuration and routing, is desirable
* AWS cloud experience, e.g. EC2, S3, RDS, IAM, VPC, ECS/EKS is a plus
* A self-starter who naturally assumes responsibility for driving projects forward
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written. Comfortable working in a distributed team of multiple nationalities
* You enjoy shaving yaks and have a thing for herding kittens
* You understand the KISS (keep it simple stupid) principle
* You are into the BSD stack, we are using both FreeBSD and OpenBSD at Flightradar24!


**About Flightradar24**
 With over 3 million daily users, Flightradar24 is the world’s most popular flight tracking service. Our app regularly tops the App Store and Google Play charts and our data is regularly cited by major media worldwide. We also offer a wide range of commercial services and customers include many of the largest names in aviation, including airlines, airports and manufacturers.
   

  

 We're constantly adding new services and improving existing products. To help us meet those challenges, we're looking for creative, collaborative and tech-savvy applicants to join us.
   

  

*Does this sound interesting but you want to know more? Just send us your questions via the button below. You can withdraw your interest at any time.*
 Flightradar24 started as a hobby project in 2006 when two Swedish aviation geeks decided to build a network of ADS-B receivers in Northern and Central Europe. In 2009 we opened up the network, and made it possible for anyone with an ADS-B receiver to upload data to the network. Many parts of the world were quickly covered, but the quest to provide global ADS-B coverage is still ongoing.
   

  

**Flightradar24 at a glance**
* Largest ADS-B network in the world with over 40,000 connected receivers
* 4+ million users per day
* 50+ million app downloads

title: Lösniningsarkitekt inom mjukvaruutveckling
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vårt körsbär på konsulttårtan är något annat. Sök jobbet och smaka själv!* 




**Rollen** 




 Som Lösningsarkitekt inom mjukvaruutveckling kommer du att inneha en central roll i att definiera och skapa övergripande tekniska lösningar för komplexa mjukvaruprojekt. Du kommer att arbeta nära företagets ledning och teknikteam för att utforma arkitekturen och säkerställa att mjukvarusystemen uppfyller företagets strategiska mål och tekniska krav. Som nyckelperson kommer du att säkerställa att tekniska lösningar stödjer företagets mål och att systemarkitekturen är stabil, skalbar och säker. Du kommer att vägleda teknikteam och säkerställa att projekt levereras med hög kvalitet och enligt tekniska riktlinjer.
 



**Erfarenhet** 




 Du har en stark bakgrund inom mjukvaruutveckling samt arkitekturarbete i agila utvecklingsprocesser och har fördelaktigt moderniserat mjukvarulösningar förr.
   

 Vi ser även att du har:
   




* Bakgrund inom utvecklin med erfarenhet av exempelvis Java, Python samt diverse ramverk
* Förmåga att förstå och översätta företagets strategiska mål till tekniska krav och lösningar.
* Design av systemarkitekturer med hänsyn till skalbarhet, prestanda och säkerhet
* Skapande av tekniska specifikationer och arkitekturdokumentation.
* Erfarenhet av molnbaserad arkitektur och tjänster som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud.
* Kunskap containerteknik som Docker och Kubernetes
* Förståelse för säkerhetsaspekter inom mjukvaruarkitektur och datahantering.



  





 Därtill är det av stor vikt att du besitter goda kommunikationsfärdigeter då arbetet ske i nära samverkan med såväl teknikteam som intressenter. Vi ser även att du är genuint intresserad av att upprätthållande kunskap om den senaste teknikutvecklingen inom mjukvaruutveckling och arkitektur.
 



**Varför ska du välja oss?** 




 Här tror vi på frihet, möjligheter och medbestämmande. Att du som medarbetare ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas och forma ditt arbete utefter dina intressen och prioriteringar i livet. Att alla får vara med och forma och påverka bolaget genom delägarskap, advisory board och projektgrupper. Att det är viktigt att ha ett sammanhang, känna tillhörighet och att man har kollegor som stöttar, utvecklar och tror på en.
 



**Om Castra** 




 Castra är en entreprenörsdriven konsultgrupp inom IT, management och systemutveckling. Bolaget ägs gemensamt av medarbetarna och tillsammans bygger vi det företag vi själva vill jobba på.
 



 Vår vision är att vi ska vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för konsulter. Att vi blivit certifierade av Great Place to Work® fem år i rad är ett bevis på våra höga mål kring företagskultur. Våra tankar om delaktighet, påverkansmöjligheter och respekt för individens egna val och möjligheter fungerar.
 



 Företaget har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Sundsvall, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping. Mer information om Castra-koncernen hittar du på vår hemsida www.castra.se.
 



**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?** 
 Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta Charlotta.Ljung@castra.se Tfn: 072-871 63 12

title: Cloud Engineer Azure & IaC
description:
**Beskrivning av tjänsten** 




 Vill du vara hjärnan bakom nästa generation av molnteknologi hos ett av Sveriges största IT-företag? Hos CGI är vi på en resa mot teknisk excellens inom Cloud och vi söker passionerade Cloud Engineers som vill vara med och driva denna framtid framåt. Här får du en unik möjlighet att arbeta med banbrytande teknologi tillsammans med likasinnade tech-entusiaster. Din arbetsplats kan vara överallt i Sverige, då vi fokuserar mer på att hitta rätt kompetens än på din geografiska placering.
 



  





**Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som Cloud Engineer kommer du att primärt fördjupa dig i spännande och utmanande projekt inom främst Microsoft Azure, men eventuellt även AWS eller Google Cloud (GCP). Du kommer att vara en nyckelperson i ett dedikerat team av Cloud-specialister som ansvarar för utveckling, drift och support av olika kunders komplexa Cloud-lösningar. Din roll innebär att du blir en domänexpert och agerar som både problemlösare och rådgivare för klienter med komplexa tekniska utmaningar. Här erbjuder vi en mångsidig arbetsmiljö där du kan bidra till förbättring av våra tjänster och delta i förändrings- och projektarbete inom såväl de ledande Public Cloud tjänsterna som CGIs Privarte Cloud tjänster. Exempel på projekt inkluderar implementering av nya klienter, integration av avancerade funktioner eller utveckling av innovativa tjänster. Vi ser gärna att du drivs av tekniska utmaningar eftersom denna roll kräver att du är i framkant av den tekniska utvecklingen. Certifieringar inom de stora publika molnplattformarna är meriterande och eftertraktade.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll** 




 För att bli framgångsrik i rollen krävs minst tre års erfarenhet av Azure och Infrastructure as code.
 



**Du har djup expertis inom åtminstone ett av följande teknikområden:** 



* Terraform eller Biceps
* Automation och skriptning
* Power Apps



  





 Att jobba som Cloud Engineer hos oss innebär inte bara att du måste kunna koda och hantera molnresurser utan vi lägger också stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper, dessa kommer vara avgörande för att du ska kunna ta din professionella utveckling till nya höjder. Du kommer att arbeta tätt tillsammans med kollegor, både internt på CGI och ute hos våra kunder. Ditt arbete kräver att du kan samarbeta effektivt och vara en integrerad del av teamet. Du behöver kunna förmedla dina idéer tydligt och professionellt, både i interna möten och i kundinteraktioner. Du är en person som kan sätta dig i andras situation och är beredd att bidra till givande diskussioner som leder till de bästa lösningarna. Ditt arbete som Cloud Engineer kommer att vara som en resa genom molnet, och det kräver mod att ständigt utmana och utvecklas. Din förmåga att ta initiativ och vara en aktiv deltagare i den här resan är vad som skiljer en bra Cloud Engineer från en enastående.
 



  





 Du behärskar flytande svenska samt engelska, eftersom kommunikation med våra kunder kan kräva flerspråkig förmåga. Vi vill även att du har svenskt medborgarskap då det kan vara aktuellt med säkerhetsklassad arbete och säkerhetsprövning kan förekomma.
 



**Vad vi erbjuder:** 




 På CGI tror vi att framgång bygger på våra medarbetare, och därför erbjuder vi alla möjligheten att bli delägare i företaget. Vårt unika ägarprogram främjar företagskulturen och ger våra medarbetare engagemang och stolthet i att vara en del av CGI. Hos oss blir du en del av en kultur som präglas av ständig teknisk utveckling, och du kommer att arbeta i en miljö där du har möjlighet att påverka och växa i ansvar, utforska nya tekniska roller och sammanhang samt kontinuerligt utvecklas. Vi erbjuder dig en global arena där du kan utvecklas och göra verklig skillnad.
 



  





**Vill du veta mer?** 




 Har du frågor om jobbet kontakta rekryterande ledare Marcus Gridange, marcus.grindange@cgi.com. Vi tillämpar löpande urval skicka därför in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
 



  





**Som anställd erbjuds du nedan förmåner:** 



* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.



  





**Övrigt** 




 Bakgrundskontroller och registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras om uppdraget kräver det.
 



**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.** 




 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
 



 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
 



 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
 



 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
 



 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.
